LEGACY_SIGNING.TITLE: Legacy Signing
LEGACY_SIGNING.BODY: Only check this option if you previously used hardware wallet signing / legacy signing to generate your keys.

REMEMBER_ME.TITLE: Remember Me
REMEMBER_ME.BODY: Only use "Remember Me" if you are using a secure device that you own. Selecting this option can expose your keys and information to others if you are on a public or non-secured device.

DYDX_ADDRESS.BODY: Your dYdX address "{DYDX_ADDRESS}" was created from the signature of the Ethereum address "{EVM_ADDRESS}".

HOLDING_HEDGIES.TITLE: Hedgies discount
HOLDING_HEDGIES.BODY: Holding a {NFT} will bump your fee discount tier up by one. Holding multiple will have no additional effect.

ACCOUNT_LEVERAGE.TITLE: Account Leverage
ACCOUNT_LEVERAGE.BODY: Leverage of your account based on all your open positions. Because your account is cross-margined, each open position has its own leverage while also affecting your overall account leverage.

BRACKET_ORDER_SL.TITLE: Stop Loss
BRACKET_ORDER_SL.BODY: Your current trigger price to execute a Stop Loss for this bracket order.

BRACKET_ORDER_TP.TITLE: Take Profit
BRACKET_ORDER_TP.BODY: Your current trigger price to execute a Take Profit for this bracket order.

BUYING_POWER.TITLE: Buying Power
BUYING_POWER.BODY: Total available buying power to increase your position on {MARKET}. Your buying power will change based on the market you have selected.

DEFAULT_EXECUTION.TITLE: Default Execution
DEFAULT_EXECUTION.BODY: Your order will fill any crossing orders at the time of opening. If your order is not fully filled, it will remain open until it is filled, cancelled, or expires.

EXPECTED_PRICE.TITLE: Expected Price
EXPECTED_PRICE.BODY: Expected price of execution for your order. This price is only an estimate as the orderbook may change before your order is processed by the matching engine.

FEE.TITLE: Fee
FEE.BODY: Fees on dYdX are charged based on liquidity type. Maker orders carry a smaller fee than taker orders.

FILL_OR_KILL.TITLE: Fill Or Kill
FILL_OR_KILL.BODY: Fill or kill orders must be completely filled upon execution or they will be automatically canceled.

FREE_COLLATERAL.TITLE: Free Collateral
FREE_COLLATERAL.BODY: The maximum amount you can withdraw. When free collateral is 0 or negative, your account is using maximum leverage.

IMMEDIATE_OR_CANCEL.TITLE: Immediate or Cancel
IMMEDIATE_OR_CANCEL.BODY: Your order will fill any crossing orders at the time of opening, and then cancel any unfilled order amount.

INDEX_PRICE.TITLE: Index Price
INDEX_PRICE.BODY: Stop orders are triggered based on the index price. The index price aggregates price data from multiple exchanges, protecting you from events like flash crashes.

INITIAL_MARGIN_FRACTION.TITLE: Initial Margin Fraction
INITIAL_MARGIN_FRACTION.BODY: Margin fraction is calculated as your position notional value divided by equity. If your margin fraction exceeds the initial margin fraction, you will no longer be allowed to increase your position. To limit risk, the initial margin fraction increases linearly with position size after a certain threshold.

INITIAL_STOP.TITLE: Initial Stop
INITIAL_STOP.BODY: Initial stop price based on your trailing percent.

LEVERAGE.TITLE: Leverage
LEVERAGE.BODY: Leverage changes the multiplier on your gains or losses. Increasing your leverage increases how much you would gain / lose on a trade with the same price movement.

LIMIT_PRICE.TITLE: Limit Price
LIMIT_PRICE.BODY: This order can only be filled at the specified limit price or better. If your order crosses at the time of placement, your order will fill any crossing orders at the most favorable price.

LIMIT_PRICE_SLIPPAGE.TITLE: Slippage
LIMIT_PRICE_SLIPPAGE.BODY: Percentage difference between your trigger price and limit price.

LIQUIDATION_PRICE.TITLE: Liquidation Price
LIQUIDATION_PRICE.BODY: If the oracle price of {SYMBOL} drops below the liquidation price, your position will be liquidated. Upon liquidation, your position will be automatically closed and a liquidation fee of at least 1% will be assessed (may be higher depending on liquidity at the time of liquidation).

LIQUIDATION_PRICE_GENERAL.TITLE: Liquidation Price
LIQUIDATION_PRICE_GENERAL.BODY: If the oracle price of the position market crosses the liquidation price, your position will be liquidated. Upon liquidation, your position will be automatically closed and a liquidation fee of at least 1% will be assessed (may be higher depending on liquidity at the time of liquidation).

LIQUIDITY.TITLE: Liquidity
LIQUIDITY.BODY: Trades that take liquidity from the book (e.g. market or crossing limit orders) execute as taker orders. Limit orders that add liquidity to the book and are filled by another party will be filled as maker orders.

MAINTENANCE_MARGIN_FRACTION.TITLE: Maintenance Margin Fraction
MAINTENANCE_MARGIN_FRACTION.BODY: Margin fraction is calculated as your position notional value divided by equity. If your margin fraction exceeds the maintenance margin fraction, your position will be automatically closed (liquidated) and a liquidation fee of at least 1% will be assessed (may be higher depending on liquidity at the time of liquidation).

MAKER_FEE.TITLE: Maker Fee
MAKER_FEE.BODY: Limit orders that add liquidity to the book and are filled by another party will be filled as maker orders. Maker orders have a lower fee than taker orders.

MARGIN_USAGE.TITLE: Margin Usage
MARGIN_USAGE.BODY: Percentage of your total margin used by open positions.

MAX_WITHDRAW.TITLE: Maximum Fast Withdraw
MAX_WITHDRAW.BODY: Maximum amount allowed for a single fast withdraw.

MAXIMUM_LEVERAGE.TITLE: Maximum Leverage
MAXIMUM_LEVERAGE.BODY: Maximum allowed leverage for this market. To limit risk, maximum leverage decreases linearly with position size after a certain threshold.

NET_FUNDING.TITLE: Net Funding
NET_FUNDING.BODY: Total funding earned / paid for the lifetime of the current position. Resets if you close your position or change position sides (long to short, or vice versa).

OPEN_INTEREST.TITLE: Open Interest
OPEN_INTEREST.BODY: Open interest represents the total size of all open positions on this market.

ORACLE_PRICE.TITLE: Oracle Price
ORACLE_PRICE.BODY: Leverage and liquidations are determined based on the on-chain oracle price. The oracle price aggregates price data from multiple exchanges, protecting you from events like flash crashes.

ORDER_AMOUNT.TITLE: Order Amount
ORDER_AMOUNT.BODY: Amount of {SYMBOL} to buy or sell. This is the amount your position will increase or decrease by when the order is filled, not your resulting position amount.

ORDER_AMOUNT_USD.TITLE: Order Amount
ORDER_AMOUNT_USD.BODY: Amount of {SYMBOL} in USD to buy or sell. This is the amount your position will increase or decrease by when the order is filled, not your resulting position amount.

POST_ONLY.TITLE: Post-Only
POST_ONLY.BODY: Orders with post-only enabled can only be placed as maker orders. If the order crosses other orders at the time of placement, it will be automatically cancelled.

PRICE_IMPACT.TITLE: Price Impact
PRICE_IMPACT.BODY: The difference between the expected execution price for your order and the best order on the bid or ask side. This will increase for larger trade sizes.

REALIZED_PNL.TITLE: Realized Profit / Loss
REALIZED_PNL.BODY: Total realized profit / loss for this position through partial closes, fees and funding. Resets if you fully close your position or change position sides (long to short, or vice versa).

REDUCE_ONLY.TITLE: Reduce-Only
REDUCE_ONLY.BODY: Reduce-Only prevents an order from changing the side of your position (long to short, or short to long). An order with Reduce-Only set will automatically resize and cancel itself as your position changes.

STEP_SIZE.TITLE: Step Size
STEP_SIZE.BODY: Step size is the smallest factor allowed for order amounts on this market.

TRIGGER_PRICE.TITLE: Trigger Price
TRIGGER_PRICE.BODY: When the index price or last trade price of this market crosses your trigger price, your stop/take profit order will either convert to a limit order or execute as a market order.

TAKER_FEE.TITLE: Taker Fee
TAKER_FEE.BODY: Trades that take liquidity from the book (e.g. market or crossing limit orders) execute as taker orders. Taker orders have a higher fee than maker orders.

TICK_SIZE.TITLE: Tick Size
TICK_SIZE.BODY: Tick size is the minimum price movement on this market.

TIME_IN_FORCE.TITLE: Time In Force
TIME_IN_FORCE.BODY: The selected time in force option controls how long an order will remain active for until it either expires or is filled.

TRAILING_PERCENT.TITLE: Trailing Percent
TRAILING_PERCENT.BODY: Trailing percent sets the percent your stop price will “trail” the index price. Whenever the index price moves in favor of your position, the stop price for your order will update according to your specified trailing percent.

UNREALIZED_PNL.TITLE: Unrealized Profit / Loss
UNREALIZED_PNL.BODY: Total profit / loss if you were to fully close the remainder of your current position at the current index price. Resets if you close your position or change position sides (long to short, or vice versa).

AVAILABLE_GASLESS_DEPOSITS.TITLE: Available
AVAILABLE_GASLESS_DEPOSITS.BODY: You are eligible! Deposit at least {GASLESS_DEPOSIT_THRESHOLD} {SYMBOL} to enable gasless deposit.

DISABLED_GASLESS_DEPOSITS.TITLE: Unavailable
DISABLED_GASLESS_DEPOSITS.BODY: Gasless deposits are temporarily unavailable. Don't worry, they'll be back soon!

GASLESS_DEPOSITS.TITLE: Gasless Deposits
GASLESS_DEPOSITS.BODY: dYdX will cover your gas fees if you deposit {GASLESS_DEPOSIT_THRESHOLD} {SYMBOL} or more. You are eligible for one gasless deposit every three days. Gasless deposits are subject to rules.

SWAP.TITLE: Swap & Deposit
SWAP.BODY: When depositing a non-USDC asset, your asset is automatically converted to USDC via the 0xSquid API. Setting max slippage allows you to specify the slippage you will allow before the conversion fails.

FAST_WITHDRAW_FEE.TITLE: Fast Withdraw Fee
FAST_WITHDRAW_FEE.BODY: Fast withdraws are sent immediately and dYdX will cover the gas costs in exchange for a fee. For fee-free withdraws, please use a slow withdraw (you pay your own gas costs and will have to wait for Layer 2 confirmation).

WITHDRAW_TYPES.TITLE: Withdraw Types
WITHDRAW_TYPES.BODY: dYdX supports two types of withdraws from Layer 2. Fast withdraws carry a small fee but do not require gas and are sent immediately. Slow withdraws are free but require two steps, take much longer, and the user will have to pay their own gas fees.

VERIFY_EMAIL.TITLE: Verify email address
VERIFY_EMAIL.BODY: Please click the link in the email we sent you, which will help us verify ownership of your email address.
